STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 15, 2025
SARA GILBERT
Rooted in Community
221 W Webster Ave, Suite 509
Muskegon, MI, 49440-1294
RE: License#: CB611003227
Dear SARA GILBERT:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on October 13, 2025. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed. The assessment noted the
agency is newly licensed and still learning how things operate for a private agency
with respect to payments and referrals. The current barrier the agency is facing is
an unexpectedly low number of referrals. They are hopeful the number will

increase in the near future. The assessment noted the agency has assembled a
capable group of staff.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget. A financial audit has not been completed as the agency is newly licensed
within the past 6 months.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Interviews were conducted with two staff via telephone. Staff reported feeling
supported by the agency. The agency is newly licensed, so the gradual
assignment of cases has been helpful and not overwhelming. Staff did not report
any concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care and licensing services. All files were stored securely and
there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
N/A
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
__________10/13/2025______________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
